results.title: Creative Activity: Our First Puppet Play
results.creator_credit: Lex Halliday, Jean Halliday and Australian Instructional Films

video_links.name: Creative Activity: Our First Puppet Play

results.brief_description: A classroom film describing the steps in the production of a puppet play by primary school children. Shows the various stages in production: planning of story and action; choosing puppets; making props and backdrop; preparing stage; allotting parts; rehearsing; finally, the finished puppet show.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lex Halliday, Jean Halliday and Australian Instructional Films

results.title: Neon
results.creator_credit: Salik Silverstein, Alex Proyas and AFTRS
results.brief_description: A single-frame time-lapse journey through Sydney, the surrealistic city. Figures dart in and out of the shadows of the night. A kaleidoscope of imagery flies by - incorporates people in subways, cars on freeways, city streets and buildings. The music (by Fad Gadget) drives the images to a tumultuous climax.

results.title: In the Wake of the Stars
results.creator_credit: Walter Batty, Mark McDonald, Bede Whiteman and Cinesound
results.brief_description: Aviation came quickly in Australia. In the early days reliable DC3’s carried everyone and everything. Then new faster and more comfortable aircraft were sought: the Fokker Friendship from Holland, the super Viscount from France and turbo jets from America. During training flights the attractions of gracious Amsterdam, gay Paris, England’s spring, New York’s people, Rome’s buildings and Australia’s scenic attractions are presented.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Walter Batty, Mark McDonald, Bede Whiteman and Cinesound

results.title: Indonesia: an Alternative Lifestyle
results.creator_credit: Leigh Tilson and Experimental Film and Television Fund
results.brief_description: A non-narrated film that contrasts behind-the-scenes life in both rural and urban Indonesia with the view of the country as seen by foreign tourists.

results.title: For Better - For Worse
results.creator_credit: John M. Bale, Don Anderson and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Dramatization of common misconceptions surrounding marriage and the types of stress contributing to marriage breakdown. Refers to alcohol, the consequences of “mateship” and violence.

results.title: ACMI Presents: A Life Exposed: Robyn Beeche

video_links.name: ACMI Presents: A Life Exposed: Robyn Beeche

results.brief_description: The 2013 documentary “A Life Exposed” (directed by Lesley Branagan) explores the life and work of Australian photographer Robyn Beeche. In this ACMI event, writer and former editor of Vogue Australia, Kirstie Clements, leads a discussion between Beeche and Branagan.
results.title_for_label: ACMI Presents: A Life Exposed: Robyn Beeche

holdings.name: MOV file H264; ACMI Digital Access Copy - presentation

results.title: Violence is Violence
results.creator_credit: Pip Starr, SKA TV and Campbell Manderson
results.brief_description: A report on the concerns over the private toll road which was built at the expense of over 2 hectares of public parkland in inner Sydney. Hundreds of Sydney residents take over the streets to protest car-dominated public space and offer a vision of urban sustainability. Their celebration is met with a brutal police response. Produced as a news story for SKA TV’s Access News, a grass-roots alternative to mainstream news and current affairs, broadcast weekly on Melbourne’s Community Television station Channel 31 since 1994.

results.title: Red Nightmare
results.creator_credit: George Waggner, William L. Hendricks, United States. Dept. of Defense and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: An anti communist drama sponsored by the U.S Government, supervised by Jack L. Warner and produced during the Cold War. The drama revolves around a small town American who takes his civil liberties for granted until he dreams of a communist takeover which jolts him out of his complacency. Narrated by Jack Webb. Photographed by Robert Hoffman. Written by Vincent Fotre. Music by William Lava. Edited by Folmer Blargsted. Starring Jack Kelly, Jeanne Cooper, Andrew Duggan, Peter Brown, Patricia Woodell, Peter Breck, Robert Conrad, Mike Road.
results.creator_credit_for_label: George Waggner, William L. Hendricks, United States. Dept. of Defense and Warner Bros Pictures

results.title: David and Jennifer Learn Their Kerb Drill
results.creator_credit: Rhonda Small, John Martin-Jones, Australian Road Safety Council and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: David and Jennifer are sent on messages to a shop across a busy street. Their mother carefully explains the meaning of the traffic lights. They sing a safety song to remember the newly learnt rules.

results.title: Curriculum by Technology
results.creator_credit: Brendan Kenworthy, Bendigo Education Resource Centre, TV Ed Productions and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: Shows how Bendigo Education Resource Centre is introducing new technology into distance education to increase the range of curriculum subjects offered for Year 11 and 12 students in isolated schoolos in the Mallee area: Telepaks, telephone links, fax machines, Macintosh computers, lessons on VHS tapes. Introduction by Justin Shortal.
